events.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia raised its cash rate by 25 bps to 3.85%.
Release of Australia's trade balance data for December.

facts.fact_text: Australia's 10-year government bond yield held steady at 4.84%.

evidences.evidence_text: Australia’s 10-year government bond yield held steady at 4.84%, near an over two-year high

facts.fact_text: The RBA raised the cash rate by 25 basis points to 3.85%.

evidences.evidence_text: On Tuesday, the RBA raised its cash rate by 25 bps to 3.85% as expected

facts.fact_text: Australia's trade surplus widened in December as exports rose and imports fell.

evidences.evidence_text: Australia’s trade surplus widened slightly more than expected in December, as exports rose while imports dropped.

claims.claim_text: Inflation is likely to remain above the 2-3% target range for at least another one to two years.
claims.author: Reserve Bank of Australia

evidences.evidence_text: The central bank also warned that inflation is likely to remain above its 2-3% target range for some time and may not return to target for at least another one to two years

claims.claim_text: There is an 80% probability of another rate hike in May.
claims.author: Traders

evidences.evidence_text: Traders have priced in around an 80% chance of a follow-up hike in May

claims.claim_text: The RBA's hawkish stance distinguishes it from other global economies that have room to ease.

evidences.evidence_text: The RBA's stance sets it apart from many other economies, most of which still have room to ease rates.

evidence.evidence_text: Australia’s 10-year government bond yield held steady at 4.84%... underpinned by a hawkish shift in the Reserve Bank’s policy outlook.
the RBA raised its cash rate by 25 bps to 3.85%... citing persistent inflation
the RBA raised its cash rate... citing... faster growth in private sector demand.
